title: Partnership trumps competition in pension companies’ merger
text:
Welcome to your preview of The Times Subscribe now Partnership trumps competition in pension companies’ merger Just Retirement and Partnership Assurance dominate the market for impaired and enhanced annuities Paul Bradbury/Getty Images Patrick Hosking Financial Editor Published 13 minutes ago 
Just Retirement and Partnership Assurance, the annuity specialists, have defied competition concerns to agree a £1.7 billion merger deal. 
The two companies, which dominate the market for impaired and enhanced annuities with a combined market share of more than 50 per cent, are confident the deal will be approved by the Competition and Markets Authority. 
Partnership shareholders will end up with about 40 per cent of the combined business, which will be renamed JRP, under an all-share offer by Just Retirement that values Partnership at £668.5 million.
